org.grails.plugin.vaadin.gsp
[Groovy] Class MapDrivenFieldFactory

java.lang.Object
  com.vaadin.ui.DefaultFieldFactory
      org.grails.plugin.vaadin.gsp.MapDrivenFieldFactory

class MapDrivenFieldFactory
extends com.vaadin.ui.DefaultFieldFactory

A Vaadin DefaultFieldFactory that uses the configuration properties in the specified map to configure new fields.

The fields map contains String fieldnames mapped to properties maps. When creating a field, the properties map for that field is looked up in the fields map. If found, all the properties in that properties map are then applied to the field object that is created.

Authors:
Francis McKenzie

Method Detail

createField

@Override
com.vaadin.ui.Field createField(com.vaadin.data.Item item, java.lang.Object propertyId, com.vaadin.ui.Component uiContext)
Creates a field by calling the superclass createField(...) method, then looks up the configuration for that field in the fields map. If found, applies all the properties in that properties map to the field object.

Note that if the field object does not support a property, then an exception will be thrown.

Also note that as a convenience this method always sets the nullRepresentation property for TextFields to an empty String.
